source: Tharon Chandler for US Senate, TN 2020
text: Petition must be copied to the counties, in order for them to count signatures and reply on the status of Tharon Chandler ... Mar 6 at 10:01 AM Dear freinds and colleagues at TN Secretary of State and also division of Elections- Mark Goins office ; Respectfully, Sir or Mam, the petition I submitted to the Executive Assistant must , at the very least, be submitted to the county election office of regard, in order for them to begin a count of valid signatures for an update on the status of the candidates petition. It must be copied to the counties, from the election division office in Nashville to the various counties of regard in the petition submitted, in order for them to count signatures and reply to the Secretary of State, division, on the status of the requirements to me be met. Thankfully I had received assistance or signatures from citizens in several different, middle Tennessee counties, and was proud to have them count. Now, when I inquired this morning (Friday the 6th of March) about the information I submitted on Monday, the 2nd day of March, to the front office there, 7th floor of Snodgrass Tower, I was told by the Executive Assistant that they are waiting for the info (or count of proper signatures, as required) to “come back from the counties”, as they “have been so busy in wrapping up from the recent election”. So I called the election office for Montgomery county in regard to the several signatures I had submitted on Monday, just to ask them a favor in regard to their work for the people, and they replied that they “have not received any document from the election division office, in regard to a count on my petition”. Freinds, I am not the one whom determined the timing for the election nor for the state PPP primary at juxtaposition to the “qualification period for candidates, for the August primary” and, though I do not doubt that they have been busy, I know they would at least have to receive the info, to be considered, before they could consider it. My own participation as a candidate, in Tennessee, is not any joy nor pleasure but is a harsh duty (self imposed) in a former slave state that is always at risk of returning to its former status.

source: Tharon Chandler for US Senate, TN 2020
text: § 2635.702 Use of public office for private gain. An employee shall not use his public office for his own private gain, for the endorsement of any product, service or enterprise, or for the private gain of friends, relatives, or persons with whom the employee is affiliated in a nongovernmental capacity, including nonprofit organizations of which the employee is an officer or member, and persons with whom the employee has or seeks employment or business relations. The specific prohibitions set forth in paragraphs (a) through (d) of this section apply this general standard, but are not intended to be exclusive or to limit the application of this section. (a) Inducement or coercion of benefits. An employee shall not use or permit the use of his Government position or title or any authority associated with his public office in a manner that is intended to coerce or induce another person, including a subordinate, to provide any benefit, financial or otherwise, to himself or to friends, relatives, or persons with whom the employee is affiliated in a nongovernmental capacity.
